Calculate the VIF for data

Source: R/linearmodelsutils.R
vif.Rd

Calculate the Variance Inflation Factor for a dataset.

vif(mod)

Arguments

mod

the data to process

Value

A matrix containing the VIF and standardised VIF factors

Examples

library(MASS)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘MASS’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:dplyr’:
#> 
#>     select
data("birthwt")
vif(lm(bwt~low+smoke+age+race, data=birthwt))
#>           GVIF Df GVIF^(1/(2*Df))
#> low   1.078953  1        1.038727
#> smoke 1.199359  1        1.095153
#> age   1.049576  1        1.024488
#> race  1.220827  1        1.104910
vif(birthwt)
#> Warning: essentially perfect fit: summary may be unreliable
#>           GVIF Df GVIF^(1/(2*Df))
#> low   2.722267  1        1.649929
#> age   1.136348  1        1.065996
#> lwt   1.205593  1        1.097995
#> race  1.300158  1        1.140245
#> smoke 1.281402  1        1.131990
#> ptl   1.152076  1        1.073348
#> ht    1.143193  1        1.069202
#> ui    1.184433  1        1.088317
#> ftv   1.077483  1        1.038019
#> bwt   2.968956  1        1.723066
